melka.echonest
Class EchoNest

java.lang.Object
  melka.echonest.EchoNest

public class EchoNest
extends java.lang.Object

This library is a wrapper that simplify the use of the Echo Nest API. The Echo Nest API allows analysis of music files based on the "Musical Brain". From The Echo Nest web site : "The Echo Nest's APIs are based on the "Musical Brain", a one-of-a-kind machine learning platform that actually listens to music and reads about music from every corner of the web. We're using the Musical Brain to power enhanced music search, recommendation and interactivity for online music services." More info : http://the.echonest.com

Author:
melka
+Example
//
// EchoNestBasics.pde

// This is just a project to show how to use the library.
// For more infos about the different classes, check the JavaDoc
// in /libraries/processingp5/reference/index.html

import melka.echonest.*;
import melka.echonest.ENTrack.*;

// Enter here your Echo Nest API Key
String APIKey = "";
// This is an mp3 file to upload.
// Put the file in your sketch's data folder
String fileToUpload = "

Method Detail

init

public EchoNest init(PApplet parent,
                     java.lang.String ApiKey,
                     java.lang.String TrackMD5)
Initialization of the EchoNest object.

Parameters:
parent - The processing sketch. Always use "this" (ie:nest.init(this,ApiKey)).
ApiKey - Your Echo Nest API key. http://developer.echonest.com/account/register/ to register.
TrackMD5 - Optional, a file's MD5 hash if it has already been analyzed.
Returns:
An EchoNest object you'll use to upload a file.

validateApiKey

public boolean validateApiKey()
Tests the API Key against the server to get sure the key can be used.

Returns:
boolean

uploadFile

public boolean uploadFile(java.lang.String filePath)
Upload a track to The Echo Nest's analyzer for analysis and later retrieval of track information. It first computes an MD5 hash of the file to check if it exists on the Echo Nest's server. If file exists, returns true. If not, tries to upload the file to the server then returns true if analysis is successful. If an error occurs, returns false.

Parameters:
filePath - Absolute or relative path of the file to upload.
Returns:
A boolean, true is successful, false if an error occurs.

initTrack

public ENTrack initTrack()
Initializes an ENTrack object for analysis retrieval. Use this functions once uploadFile has returned true.

Returns:
An ENTrack object.

public java.lang.String version()
Return the version of the library.
